channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Generalized Parametric Contrastive Learning
item.description: Based on theoretical analysis, we observe that supervised contrastive loss tends to bias high-frequency classes and thus increases the difficulty of imbalanced learning.

item.title: Learning to Learn with Generative Models of Neural Network Checkpoints
item.description: We explore a data-driven approach for learning to optimize neural networks.

item.title: Legal Case Document Similarity: You Need Both Network and Text
item.description: Our experiments establish that our proposed network-based methods significantly improve the correlation with domain experts' opinion when compared to the existing methods for network-based legal document similarity.

item.title: Exploring Attention GAN for Vehicle Motion Prediction
item.description: The design of a safe and reliable Autonomous Driving stack (ADS) is one of the most challenging tasks of our era.

item.title: Multi-dataset Training of Transformers for Robust Action Recognition
item.description: We study the task of robust feature representations, aiming to generalize well on multiple datasets for action recognition.

item.title: FORESEE: Model-based Reinforcement Learning using Unscented Transform with application to Tuning of Control Barrier Functions
item.description: Our method, depending on the number of sigma points employed, can propagate either mean and covariance with minimal points, or higher-order moments with more points similarly to Monte Carlo.

item.title: Where2comm: Communication-Efficient Collaborative Perception via Spatial Confidence Maps
item.description: Where2comm has two distinct advantages: i) it considers pragmatic compression and uses less communication to achieve higher perception performance by focusing on perceptually critical areas; and ii) it can handle varying communication bandwidth by dynamically adjusting spatial areas involved in communication.

item.title: Modeling Content-Emotion Duality via Disentanglement for Empathetic Conversation
item.description: To solve the task, it is essential to model the content-emotion duality of a dialogue, which is composed of the content view (i. e., what personal experiences are described) and the emotion view (i. e., the feelings of the speaker on these experiences).

item.title: Device-friendly Guava fruit and leaf disease detection using deep learning
item.description: This work presents a deep learning-based plant disease diagnostic system using images of fruits and leaves.

item.title: Rethinking Motion Deblurring Training: A Segmentation-Based Method for Simulating Non-Uniform Motion Blurred Images
item.description: Successful training of end-to-end deep networks for real motion deblurring requires datasets of sharp/blurred image pairs that are realistic and diverse enough to achieve generalization to real blurred images.

item.title: An Explainable Machine Learning Approach to Visual-Interactive Labeling: A Case Study on Non-communicable Disease Data
item.description: We demonstrate that EBM is an excellent choice of predictive model by comparing it against a rule-based and four other machine learning models.

item.title: Text Summarization with Oracle Expectation
item.description: Extractive summarization produces summaries by identifying and concatenating the most important sentences in a document.

item.title: Rethinking Resolution in the Context of Efficient Video Recognition
item.description: Our key finding is that the major cause of degradation is not information loss in the down-sampling process, but rather the mismatch between network architecture and input scale.

item.title: Multi-stage image denoising with the wavelet transform
item.description: Deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs) are used for image denoising via automatically mining accurate structure information.

item.title: TAD: A Large-Scale Benchmark for Traffic Accidents Detection from Video Surveillance
item.description: After integration and annotation by various dimensions, a large-scale traffic accidents dataset named TAD is proposed in this work.

item.title: Out-of-Distribution Detection with Hilbert-Schmidt Independence Optimization
item.description: Existing works attempt to solve the problem by explicitly imposing uncertainty on classifiers when OOD inputs are exposed to the classifier during training.

item.title: Real-RawVSR: Real-World Raw Video Super-Resolution with a Benchmark Dataset
item.description: Our code and dataset are available at https://github. com/zmzhang1998/Real-RawVSR.

item.title: On Projections to Linear Subspaces
item.description: The merit of projecting data onto linear subspaces is well known from, e. g., dimension reduction.

item.title: Can Large Language Models Truly Understand Prompts? A Case Study with Negated Prompts
item.description: Previous work has shown that there exists a scaling law between the size of Language Models (LMs) and their zero-shot performance on different downstream NLP tasks.

item.title: SAPA: Similarity-Aware Point Affiliation for Feature Upsampling
item.description: We introduce point affiliation into feature upsampling, a notion that describes the affiliation of each upsampled point to a semantic cluster formed by local decoder feature points with semantic similarity.

item.title: Material Prediction for Design Automation Using Graph Representation Learning
item.description: Successful material selection is critical in designing and manufacturing products for design automation.

item.title: A heterogeneous group CNN for image super-resolution
item.description: To prevent loss of original information, a multi-level enhancement mechanism guides a CNN to achieve a symmetric architecture for promoting expressive ability of HGSRCNN.

item.title: EasyRec: An easy-to-use, extendable and efficient framework for building industrial recommendation systems
item.description: We present EasyRec, an easy-to-use, extendable and efficient recommendation framework for building industrial recommendation systems.

item.title: Neural State-Space Modeling with Latent Causal-Effect Disentanglement
item.description: In a novel neural formulation of state-space models (SSMs), we first introduce causal-effect modeling of the latent dynamics via a system of interacting neural ODEs that separately describes 1) the continuous-time dynamics of the internal intervention, and 2) its effect on the trajectory of the system's native state.

item.title: VAESim: A probabilistic approach for self-supervised prototype discovery
item.description: Then, we reconstruct the sample based on a similarity measure between the sample embedding and the prototypical vectors of the clusters.

item.title: Application of Deep Learning in Generating Structured Radiology Reports: A Transformer-Based Technique
item.description: Our transformer-based model in this study outperformed previously applied approaches such as ANN and CNN models based on ROUGE-1, ROUGE-2, ROUGE-L, and BLEU scores of 0. 816, 0. 668, 0. 528, and 0. 743, respectively, while providing an interpretable structured report.

item.title: Exploring Example Influence in Continual Learning
item.description: Continual Learning (CL) sequentially learns new tasks like human beings, with the goal to achieve better Stability (S, remembering past tasks) and Plasticity (P, adapting to new tasks).

item.title: Optimal Transport-based Identity Matching for Identity-invariant Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: Specifically, to find pairs of similar expressions from different identities, we define the inter-feature similarity as a transportation cost.

item.title: Multimodal Exponentially Modified Gaussian Oscillators
item.description: Acoustic modeling serves de-noising, data reconstruction, model-based testing and classification in audio processing tasks.

item.title: Dive into Self-Supervised Learning for Medical Image Analysis: Data, Models and Tasks
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) has achieved remarkable performance on various medical imaging tasks by dint of priors from massive unlabeled data.

item.title: Multi-modal Segment Assemblage Network for Ad Video Editing with Importance-Coherence Reward
item.description: The existing method performs well at video segmentation stages but suffers from the problems of dependencies on extra cumbersome models and poor performance at the segment assemblage stage.

item.title: D$^{\bf{3}}$: Duplicate Detection Decontaminator for Multi-Athlete Tracking in Sports Videos
item.description: In this paper, the duplicate detection is newly and precisely defined as occlusion misreporting on the same athlete by multiple detection boxes in one frame.

item.title: Non-monotonic Resource Utilization in the Bandits with Knapsacks Problem
item.description: Bandits with knapsacks (BwK) is an influential model of sequential decision-making under uncertainty that incorporates resource consumption constraints.

item.title: Global Semantic Descriptors for Zero-Shot Action Recognition
item.description: This work introduces a new ZSAR method based on the relationships of actions-objects and actions-descriptive sentences.

item.title: Face Super-Resolution Using Stochastic Differential Equations
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first time SDEs have been used for such an application.

item.title: Developing a Knowledge Graph Framework for Pharmacokinetic Natural Product-Drug Interactions
item.description: NP-KG is a heterogeneous KG with biomedical ontologies, linked data, and full texts of the scientific literature, constructed with the Phenotype Knowledge Translator framework and the semantic relation extraction systems, SemRep and Integrated Network and Dynamic Reasoning Assembler.

item.title: Dead or Murdered? Predicting Responsibility Perception in Femicide News Reports
item.description: We then train regression models that predict the salience of GBV participants with respect to different dimensions of perceived responsibility.

item.title: Composite Layers for Deep Anomaly Detection on 3D Point Clouds
item.description: Moreover, our CompositeNets substantially outperform existing solutions for anomaly detection on point clouds.

item.title: Unsupervised Hashing with Semantic Concept Mining
item.description: Recently, to improve the unsupervised image retrieval performance, plenty of unsupervised hashing methods have been proposed by designing a semantic similarity matrix, which is based on the similarities between image features extracted by a pre-trained CNN model.

item.title: On Efficient Reinforcement Learning for Full-length Game of StarCraft II
item.description: In this work, we investigate a set of RL techniques for the full-length game of StarCraft II.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Two-Stage Training Scheme for Deep Video Fight Detection Model
item.description: In this paper, we propose a simple but effective method that solves the task from a new perspective: we design the fight detection model as a composition of an action-aware feature extractor and an anomaly score generator.

item.title: Motion Guided Deep Dynamic 3D Garments
item.description: Technically, we model garment dynamics, driven using the input character motion, by predicting per-frame local displacements in a canonical state of the garment that is enriched with frame-dependent skinning weights to bring the garment to the global space.

item.title: GLSO: Grammar-guided Latent Space Optimization for Sample-efficient Robot Design Automation
item.description: In this work, we present Grammar-guided Latent Space Optimization (GLSO), a framework that transforms design automation into a low-dimensional continuous optimization problem by training a graph variational autoencoder (VAE) to learn a mapping between the graph-structured design space and a continuous latent space.

item.title: Tensor-Based Multi-Modality Feature Selection and Regression for Alzheimer's Disease Diagnosis
item.description: The assessment of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) and Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) associated with brain changes remains a challenging task.

item.title: I-SPLIT: Deep Network Interpretability for Split Computing
item.description: A neuron is important if its gradient with respect to the correct class decision is high.

item.title: A Neural Model for Regular Grammar Induction
item.description: Grammatical inference is a classical problem in computational learning theory and a topic of wider influence in natural language processing.

item.title: Accurate and Efficient Stereo Matching via Attention Concatenation Volume
item.description: In this paper, we present a novel cost volume construction method, named attention concatenation volume (ACV), which generates attention weights from correlation clues to suppress redundant information and enhance matching-related information in the concatenation volume.

item.title: Quantile-constrained Wasserstein projections for robust interpretability of numerical and machine learning models
item.description: Numerical experiments on real case studies, from the UQ and ML fields, highlight the computational feasibility of such studies and provide local and global insights on the robustness of black-box models to input perturbations.

item.title: ET5: A Novel End-to-end Framework for Conversational Machine Reading Comprehension
item.description: Conversational machine reading comprehension (CMRC) aims to assist computers to understand an natural language text and thereafter engage in a multi-turn conversation to answer questions related to the text.

item.title: Towards Frame Rate Agnostic Multi-Object Tracking
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Frame Rate Agnostic MOT framework with Periodic training Scheme (FAPS) to tackle the FraMOT problem for the first time.
